body.name: WD Blue 2TB Mobile Hard Disk Drive - 5400 RPM SATA 6 Gb/s 128MB Cache 2.5 Inch 7mm - WD20SPZX WD Recertified (Renewed)
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 18 hrs
features: WD F.I.T. Lab certified to work with a wide range of high-performance PC configurations
WD Factory Recertified with zero Power on Hours
body.description: WD Blue hard drives deliver solid performance and reliability while providing you with all the space you need to hold an enormous amount of photos, video, and files. These drives are designed for use as primary drives in notebooks, external enclosures and for certain industrial applications. With a wide array of capacities, cache sizes, and interfaces means there is a WD Blue hard drive that is just right for you. And because it is from WD, you will have the confidence in knowing you have selected a drive that is truly world-class.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars What it says, yes, reccomended. update: Second one, all good
reviews.reviewText: UPDATE: ok got my second one of these today. Again well packed. Crystal Disk Info, all good. Zero power on hours power on count 1. SMART data all passed. Western Digital Data Lifeguard Quick Test. Passed. SO again, no reason to doubt these aren't WELL worth the (currently) $55.First one, (original review): First off, well packed. Lots of large bubble-bubble-wrap, tightly secured, right-sized box inside envelope. Can't recall if the envelope was padded but it wouldn't have needed to be. Took a few days long to arrive, probably not related to how fast the seller got the item out the door. Didn't pay attention to that. The drive itself, sealed anti-static bag, like new, looked new no scuffs or signs of wear. SMART data all good. 0 power-on hours/count. GRANTED, I hear, 'they' now have the means to wipe SMART data... so... I also tested it with Western Digital Data Lifeguard Diagnostic - Quick Test, takes 2 minutes, (probably "CHKDSK" under the hood) but all good there. I strange thing, notice the listing shows pictures only for the "under-side" of the disc? Well, because, the topside is completely covered by a blank white sticker/cover/label. I'd include a pic but the drive is installed already. So clearly there's something they don't want you know. The good news is SMART data identifies a model number consistent with what's shown on the under-side sticker. So it IS a Western Digital Blue. Based on that I was not motivated to try and peel the topside sticker off. I bought this to upgrade the 1tb hd in my AFN receiver/dvr. Testing on the PC first had shown the drive as not initialized, (like new). I put it in the dvr as was, un-initialized.As soon as the unit finished booting up it immediately launched into formatting the drive. After that finished a second power-plug-pulled reboot was required to clear some odd behavior. Since then no issues. (nothing that wasn't also true with the original 1TB HD) The only difference being as expected, the recording capacity is roughly doubled. Would buy again. Actually, I just did. I have 2 of these receivers and the 2 TB size is just the ticket. I've found no reason these aren't well worth the bargain price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Backup for a faulty Adata SSD
reviews.reviewText: I had to get this. I had this laptop for almost two years. When I finally open it, I see that the SSD is a generic brand by Adata. I had no idea my computer had a second ssd(sata III), so I was writing and deleting making the drive worse off. My computer failed because this fugly ssd was install in my laptop before purchase. Go with Western digital, and keep all your writing to and from, on the hdd.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Transferencia de datos de mala calidad
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Se a quedado congelado transfiriendo un archivo de 2.70 gb, solo con un archivo, si ya es así de lento , no funcionará para juegos ni para nada, comiensa oscilar el tiempo de trasferencia y no permite pasar el archivo, llega a un punto donde no avanza y no responde. El disco causa erró y da pantallazos azules, no comroar por ningún motivo.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars White label DOA.
reviews.reviewText: Added it to my computer, it was not recognized. It had power, it spun, but did not appear in the list of hard drives.Mounted it in another computer, same story.Tried a USB adapter cable, no joy. Am returning for refund.
